snippet.title: Vic driver put kids' lives at risk: court
snippet.content: A Melbourne man has faced court with cuts on his forehead and a bruised eye after he allegedly drove at speed on a footpath near a school, narrowly avoiding children. Tyson Anthony Vidal, 34, is accused of driving a stolen car on the wrong side of the road at the Mornington Peninsula on Friday afternoon before a dramatic arrest at a petrol station in Clayton. Vidal faced Melbourne Magistrates' Court charged with seven offences, including driving on a footpath while children were in the area, endangering their lives. (C) AAP 2017
